title: Marco Pantani: Italian cycling hero's mysterious death and maverick life
description: Marco Pantani's maverick life ended in a mysterious death. Nearly 20 years on, the questions and investigations continue amid claims that powerful criminals wanted Italy's star cyclist dead.

title: Man charged over death of 12-year-old on M62
description: Callum Rycroft, 12, from Leeds, was killed on the M62 in West Yorkshire on Saturday.

title: Landmark 'wonky' Crooked House demolished
description: The Crooked House pub, once known as "Britain's wonkiest pub", is demolished two days after a fire.

title: The Hundred 2023: Manchester Originals beat Birmingham Phoenix for first victory
description: Manchester Originals beat Birmingham Phoenix by 49 runs at Emirates Old Trafford to secure their first victory of this year's Hundred.

title: Ukraine war: Several killed in Russian missile strike eastern Ukraine, officials say
description: President Zelensky said the Russian attacks had struck an "ordinary residential building".

title: Higher food prices may be here to stay, says Bank economist
description: Chief economist Huw Pill has warned that food prices may never return to levels previously seen.

title: William Friedkin: Director of The Exorcist and The French Connection dies aged 87
description: His Oscar-winning career spanned six decades and also included crime thriller The French Connection.

title: Cycling World Championships 2023: Great Britain's Kieran Reilly wins BMX freestyle gold
description: Kieran Reilly won the men's elite BMX freestyle park to get Great Britain's first gold medal of day five and claim his first world title.

title: Fifteen asylum seekers board Bibby Stockholm on first day
description: The Home Office says "a small group" of about 20 people refused to board the Bibby Stockholm.

title: West Ham eye Harry Maguire and Scott McTominay from Man Utd as Gianluca Scamacca leaves
description: West Ham are keen on Manchester United pair Harry Maguire and Scott McTominay, while Gianluca Scamacca leaves the club to join Atalanta.

title: Nike and Adidas urged by MPs to promote female football boots
description: MPs are investigating the lack of boots designed for women and girls, amid concern about injuries.

title: UK summer forecast: Is sunny weather ever coming before winter?
description: With cooler than average temperatures in July, hopes of sun and heat lie on the rest of August.

title: Senior doctors plan 48-hour strike for September in England
description: The walkout will affect routine services in England, but emergency care will be provided.

title: Britishvolt buyer hasn't made final payment, administrators say
description: A deal to buy the failed battery firm now looks uncertain after the final payment was missed.

title: Even Zoom is cutting remote work policies
description: The company says staff living near offices should work in person at least twice a week.

title: BBC presenter Nick Owen reveals prostate cancer diagnosis
description: The broadcaster describes the day he was told he had prostate cancer as among the worst of his life.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: How Morocco have made history again
description: The story of how Morocco made history again at the Women's World Cup.

title: Women's World Cup: England ride luck and stumble to victory after Lauren James sees red
description: England go agonisingly close to an early exit from the Women's World Cup but find a way to win as the Lionesses' title dream lives on.

title: Prison and probation staffing dangerously low
description: The Ministry of Justice publishes its views on the services accidentally on a government website.

title: The Hundred: Fi Morris completes first women's Hundred five-wicket haul
description: Manchester Original's Fi Morris completes the first ever five-wicket haul in the women's Hundred against Birmingham Phoenix.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: England's knockout stage path
description: England appear to be in a more favourable side of the draw at the Women's World Cup, although a competition of upsets has shown no team can be underestimated.

title: Three hillwalkers found dead in Glen Coe
description: Police say the bodies were discovered after they failed to return from the Aonach Eagach Ridge.

title: Italian man crushed to death under falling cheese wheels
description: Giacomo Chiapparini was buried when a shelf broke in his warehouse in the Lombardy region on Sunday.

title: Hank the Tank: Fugitive burglar bear captured in California
description: The large and notoriously hungry female bear is believed to have broken into 21 homes since 2022.

title: Brick Lane: Chinese political slogans appear on London street art wall
description: Communist Party slogans were painted over popular wall art - but the creators' motive is unclear.

title: A Moscow summer with war on people's minds
description: After the Russian capital was targeted by drones, Steve Rosenberg asks people how they feel about the future.

title: England World Cup squad: Steve Borthwick says positional 'flexibility' key to selection
description: England coach Steve Borthwick says players' versatility was an "important aspect" of his World Cup squad selection.

title: Harry Kane: Tottenham reject latest Bayern Munich offer for England captain
description: Tottenham rejects Bayern Munich's latest offer for Harry Kane, with the two clubs apart on their valuation of the striker.

title: Andrew Malkinson: Greater Manchester Police criticised over trial evidence
description: Andrew Malkinson says Greater Manchester Police's actions caused his "wrongful conviction nightmare".

title: Greenpeace: Government cuts ties with group after protest at PM's home
description: No 10 says it is not "appropriate" to engage with the group after a stunt at Rishi Sunak's house.

title: Central African Republic President Touadéra wins referendum with Wagner help
description: Referendum results say 95% of voters back the changes but turnout is believed to be very low.

title: AIG Women's Open: 'Celine Boutier the player to beat at Walton Heath'
description: France's Celine Boutier goes into the AIG Women's Open in Surrey with two wins and a combined score of 29 under par from her past two events.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: Australia beat Denmark to reach quarter-finals - highlights
description: Watch highlights as co-hosts Australia reach the Women's World Cup quarter-finals with a clinical win over Denmark.

title: Nadine Dorries faces move to force her out of Parliament
description: Nadine Dorries could be suspended if she does not attend Commons for six months, a senior Labour MP says.

title: Lauren James: England star lost her emotions for red card, says Sarina Wiegman
description: Lauren James "in a split-second lost her emotions" says boss Sarina Wiegman as England beat Nigeria on penalties in the Women's World Cup.

title: GB News: Politicians' shows under scrutiny in new Ofcom investigations
description: Shows hosted by Sir Jacob Rees-Mogg, Philip Davies, Esther McVey and Martin Daubney are examined.

title: 'Questions need answering' over Crooked House fire
description: An investigation continues into the destruction of the celebrated and unusual pub building near Dudley.

title: Matty Healy: The 1975 threatened with legal action after Malaysia festival cancellation
description: The festival was cancelled after the band's singer launched an attack on Malaysia's LGBT laws.

title: Strictly's Shirley Ballas charity skydive after brother's suicide
description: Shirley Ballas says she is scared of heights, but is "more terrified of losing another person to suicide".

title: Women's World Cup 2023: England beat Nigeria in penalty shootout to progress to quarter-finals - highlights
description: Watch highlights as England scrape through to the quarter-finals of the Women's World Cup with a dramatic penalty shootout victory over Nigeria despite Lauren James' red card.

title: Matt Turner: Nottingham Forest agree deal with Arsenal for USA international goalkeeper
description: Nottingham Forest have agreed a fee with Arsenal to sign USA international goalkeeper Matt Turner.

description: England survive Lauren James' sending-off and a gruelling Nigeria onslaught to reach the quarter-finals of the Women's World Cup.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: Chloe Kelly fires England into quarter-finals with winning penalty
description: Watch the winning moment as Chloe Kelly fires England into the Women's World Cup quarter-finals by scoring the winning penalty in the shootout against Nigeria.

title: Ex-singer Ian Watkins' jail injuries not life threatening
description: The disgraced musician was stabbed at HMP Wakefield, where he is serving a 29-year sentence.

title: Mohamed Salah 'committed' to Liverpool amid Saudi Arabia transfer link - agent
description: Mohamed Salah is "committed" to Liverpool his agent has said, amid reports of a huge offer from Saudi Arabia for the Egyptian.

title: California: Three killed in firefighting helicopter crash
description: An investigation is underway into the deaths of two fire staff and a pilot in California.

title: Angus Cloud: Euphoria star's mother says his death was 'not intentional'
description: Angus Cloud had a "joyful" final day and "did not intend to end his life", the actor's mother says.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: England's Lauren James sent off for stamp against Nigeria
description: England's Lauren James is sent off after a VAR review adjudged her to have stamped on Nigeria's Michelle Alozie during their Women's World Cup last 16 match.

title: New Troubles inquests ordered into five UVF murders
description: There is new evidence on the shootings in Mid-Ulster over 30 years ago, says the attorney general.

title: England World Cup squad: Henry Slade & Alex Dombrandt miss out, Joe Marchant & Theo Dan in
description: Henry Slade and Alex Dombrandt are among the notable absentees from Steve Borthwick's England squad for the Rugby World Cup.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: VAR intervenes to overturn England penalty decision against Nigeria
description: VAR intervenes to overturn the decision to award England a penalty after Rachel Daly went down in the Nigeria box at the Women's World Cup.

description: Watch as Nigeria comes close to opening the scoring against England with two "spectacular" chances at the Women's World Cup.

title: House prices fall by the most in south east, says Halifax
description: The value of a home in the region dropped by £15,500 while the "pandemic boom" ended for Wales.

title: Watch: Moment Alaska house collapses into river
description: Glacial floods in Juneau, the capital of Alaska, caused a house to collapse into the Mendenhall river.

title: Pulling out of S Korea camp will hit UK Scouts for years
description: The UK chief executive says he feels let down by organisers of the World Scout Jamboree in South Korea.

title: Women's World Cup 2023: Colombia v Jamaica - Lorne Donaldson ready for 'boxing match'
description: Coach Lorne Donaldson says Jamaica are prepared for a "boxing match" against Colombia in their Women's World Cup last-16 meeting in Melbourne.

title: Citi Open: Dan Evans beats Tallon Griekspoor to win first ATP 500 title
description: British number two Dan Evans beats Dutchman Tallon Griekspoor in straight sets to claim the Citi Open title.

title: I'm A Celebrity: Gwrych castle granted £2m for repairs
description: Officials say the Grade I listed venue can now go from "perilous condition" to its former glory.

title: Laura Nuttall: 'My sister's strength inspired me to keep going'
description: Gracie Nuttall was just 16 years old when her sister was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer.

title: Chandrayaan-3: Historic India Moon mission sends new photos of lunar surface
description: If Chandrayaan-3 succeeds, India will be the first country to land near the Moon's little-explored south pole.

title: Oldham couple whose son died want answers over mould-infested home
description: A couple whose son died in a mould-infested home want to know why their warnings were ignored.

title: HSBC executive sorry for saying UK 'weak' over China
description: Sir Sherard Cowper-Coles' comments come as US-China ties have become increasingly tense in recent years.

title: Bibby Stockholm: First asylum seekers to board barge
description: The barge, docked in Dorset, will house up to 500 people in plans critics have called inhumane.

title: Niger coup: Junta shuts airspace citing military intervention threat
description: Niger's neighbours earlier threatened to act if the elected president was not restored by end of Sunday.

title: Mother awake for 60 hours as son's care breaks down
description: NHS system for seriously ill people requiring home care is struggling to provide sufficient support.

title: The Papers: 'Plan B on Rwanda' as 'MPs defy second jobs anger'
description: Monday's front pages focus on immigration, and government plans for asylum seekers.

title: Florida: Man rescued from partially sunken boat after 35 hours at sea
description: The 25-year-old was reported missing after failing to return from a fishing trip in St Augustine, Florida.
